title: Problem Overview
content:
**Erdős Problem #636: Distinct Induced Subgraphs in Ramsey Graphs**

Must a Ramsey graph (no large clique or independent set) on n vertices have Θ(n^(5/2)) induced subgraphs with distinct (vertex, edge) signatures?

**Status**: SOLVED by Kwan-Sudakov (2021)

**Answer**: YES - exactly Θ(n^(5/2)) distinct signatures.

title: Graph Type
content:
**Graph V**: Abbreviation for SimpleGraph V.

A simple graph on vertex set V (no self-loops, no multi-edges).

title: Clique Number
content:
**cliqueNumber G**: ω(G) = size of largest clique in G.

A clique is a set of pairwise adjacent vertices.

Uses Mathlib's SimpleGraph.cliqueNum.

title: Independence Number
content:
**independenceNumber G**: α(G) = size of largest independent set.

An independent set has no two adjacent vertices.

Defined as clique number of complement: α(G) = ω(Gᶜ).

title: No Large Homogeneous Set
content:
**NoLargeHomogeneousSet G k**: Both ω(G) ≤ k and α(G) ≤ k.

A 'homogeneous set' is either a clique or independent set.

This is the key Ramsey-type condition.

title: Induced Subgraph
content:
**inducedSubgraph G S**: The subgraph of G induced by vertex set S.

Edges are exactly those of G between vertices in S.

Uses Mathlib's SimpleGraph.induce.

title: Induced Edge Count
content:
**inducedEdgeCount G S**: Number of edges in the induced subgraph G[S].

Counted via the edge finset cardinality.

title: Signature
content:
**Signature**: A pair (vertex count, edge count) = ℕ × ℕ.

**getSignature G S**: Returns (|S|, |E(G[S])|).

Two induced subgraphs have the same signature iff they have the same number of vertices AND edges.

title: Counting Signatures
content:
**allSignatures G**: The set of all distinct signatures achievable by induced subgraphs of G.

**distinctSignatureCount G**: The cardinality |allSignatures G|.

This is the quantity the problem asks about.

title: Different Signatures
content:
**DifferentSignatures G S₁ S₂**: Two induced subgraphs have different signatures.

getSignature G S₁ ≠ getSignature G S₂

They differ in vertex count or edge count (or both).

title: Ramsey Bound
content:
**ramseyBound k**: Rough upper bound 2^(2k) on R(k,k).

**ramsey_graphs_exist**: For n ≥ R(k,k), there exist graphs with ω, α ≤ k.

This is a classical Ramsey theory existence result.

title: Ramsey Graph Condition
content:
**IsRamseyGraph G C**: ω(G), α(G) ≤ C log n.

This is the precise condition: no homogeneous set larger than O(log n).

Such graphs exist by probabilistic arguments.

title: Erdős-Faudree-Sós Theorem
content:
**erdos_faudree_sos**: Ramsey graphs have ≥ cn^(3/2) distinct signatures.

This was the original bound proved by Erdős, Faudree, and Sós.

Later improved by Kwan-Sudakov to n^(5/2).

title: Kwan-Sudakov Theorem
content:
**kwan_sudakov (2021)**: Ramsey graphs have ≥ cn^(5/2) distinct signatures.

This is the optimal lower bound, improving the EFS result.

**ks_improves_efs**: 5/2 > 3/2 (the improvement).

title: Upper Bound
content:
**signature_upper_bound**: No Ramsey graph has more than O(n^(5/2)) distinct signatures.

**exponent_optimal**: The exponent 5/2 is optimal.

This gives the matching upper bound.

title: Theta Bound
content:
**theta_bound**: Θ(n^(5/2)) distinct signatures.

Combines the Kwan-Sudakov lower bound and the upper bound.

∃ c₁, c₂ > 0: c₁n^(5/2) ≤ distinctSignatureCount G ≤ c₂n^(5/2)

title: Proof Techniques
content:
**ks_probabilistic_method**: The proof uses probabilistic arguments.

**signature_distribution**: Signatures are well-distributed in the (v, e) plane.

**vertex_count_range**: Vertex count ranges 0 to n.

Key insight: random induced subgraphs have spread-out signatures.

title: Edge Count Range
content:
**edge_count_range**: |E(G[S])| ≤ |S|(|S|-1)/2.

The edge count is bounded by the maximum possible edges.

This is the complete graph bound.

title: Ramsey Condition Essential
content:
**non_ramsey_smaller_bound**: Without the Ramsey condition, fewer signatures possible.

**clique_few_signatures**: Complete graphs have ≤ n+1 signatures.

**empty_few_signatures**: Empty graphs have ≤ n+1 signatures.

The Ramsey condition is essential for the n^(5/2) bound.

title: Ramsey Forces Complexity
content:
**ramsey_forces_complexity**: The Ramsey condition forces 'complex' local structure.

Without large cliques or independent sets, the graph must have varied local behavior.

This variation yields many different signatures.

title: Related Problems
content:
**CountDistinctIsomorphismTypes**: Counting distinct induced subgraphs up to isomorphism (much harder).

**ErdosHajnalConjecture**: Related conjecture about excluding induced subgraphs.

**induced_path_count**: Counting specific induced structures.

title: Main Result
content:
**erdos_636**: Erdős Problem #636 is SOLVED.

Question: Must a Ramsey graph have ≫ n^(5/2) distinct signatures?

Answer: YES (Kwan-Sudakov 2021)

The theorem follows directly from kwan_sudakov.

title: Final Answer
content:
**erdos_636_answer**: "SOLVED: Kwan-Sudakov (2021) proved Θ(n^(5/2)) distinct signatures"

**erdos_636_exponent**: 5/2

The problem is completely resolved with tight bounds.
